net.corda.core.contracts

Class TransactionVerificationException


  • public class TransactionVerificationException

    Indicates that some aspect of the transaction named by txId violates the platform rules. The exact type of failure is expressed using a subclass. TransactionVerificationException is a exception FlowException and thus when thrown inside a flow, the details of the failure will be serialised, propagated to the peer and rethrown.

    See Also:
    exception FlowException

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionVerificationException

        public TransactionVerificationException(@NotNull
                                        SecureHash txId,
                                        @NotNull
                                        java.lang.String message,
                                        @Nullable
                                        java.lang.Throwable cause)

        Indicates that some aspect of the transaction named by txId violates the platform rules. The exact type of failure is expressed using a subclass. TransactionVerificationException is a exception FlowException and thus when thrown inside a flow, the details of the failure will be serialised, propagated to the peer and rethrown.

        Parameters:
        txId - the Merkle root hash (identifier) of the transaction that failed verification.
        See Also:
        exception FlowException

      • getTxId

        (identifier) of the transaction that failed verification.
